director.name: 丹尼尔·丹席克 Daniel Dencik

introduction: A stranger die in the wilderness. An opportunity presents itself. The aim is to investigate modern humanity and the desire to escape, change, and be someone other than oneself. It is a story about love's journey and the detours we meet when identities disintegrate. MISS OSAKA is the tale of Ines, a young Danish woman, who has ended up on the outskirts of her own life.Unconfident about herself, Ines (24), dreams of being someone else. She accompanies her boyfriend Lucas on his business trip to Norway, where they meet Maria, an American-Japanese woman. Maria is brimming over with confidence and charm, and leads a gorgeous life in Osaka, Japan. Ines and Maria hit it off in spite of their opposite personalities, and Ines grows her admiration for Maria. something unexpected happens, and Ines leaves for Osaka, and starts working at the nightclub MISS OSAKA - a world where boundaries are broken, identities dissolve and new ones are being constructed. Ines engages in a dangerous masquerade, ..
